title: Submissions to the Department of Education's Office of Civil RIghts Data Collection

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

the annual submission made to the US Department of Education's Office of Civil Right's Civil RIghts Data Collection for the following school years:

* 2021-2022
* 2022-2023
* 2023-2024

a version of this data for the 2017-2018 school years appears here: https://civilrightsdata.ed.gov/profile/us/mi/ann_arbor_public_schools?surveyYear=2017&nces=2602820

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Forest Gregg

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Washington Post Correspondence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records of communications between any member of the VMI Marketing and Communication's Office, The Superintendent's staff, the Board of Visitors Staff, and Mr. Tom Watjen with the Washington Post on the subject of the BOV Special session, Maj Gen. Wins' contract, contract extension, new contract or related topics. This is to include such communications to provide the Washington Post Maj. Gen. Win's statement of March 6, 2025 and Mr. Watjen's resignation letter and the email to the VMI Faculty, staff, cadets, VMI Alumni Agencies,  etc. of Maj. Gen. Wins' statement. I am willing to accept incremental delivery.  At the minimum VMI should be able to provide the communications involving how the Washington Post became aware of, requested, and were provided Mr. Watjen's resignation letter and the Superintendent's Statement on the BOV decision not to renew his contract immediately as these stories were just published recently with those documents.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.
